House Bill/Resolution NO. HB00102
FULL TITLE : AN ACT ESTABLISHING THE COCONUT FARMERS AND INDUSTRY TRUST FUND AND PROVIDING FOR ITS MANAGEMENT AND UTILIZATION
SHORT TITLE : Coconut Farmers And Industry Development Act
ABSTRACT : Seeks to consolidate all coconut levy assets into a trust fund called Farmers and Industry Trust Fund; delineate the Trust Fund from the General Fund, hence preventing the marriage of the two; create the Coconut Farmers and Industry Trust Fund Committee under the Office of the President to be chaired by the Secretary of Agriculture with the primary task of monitoring the implementation of the Fund and the Coconut Industry Development Plan, which shall be use as a guide in the utilization of the trust income; empower the Privatization and Management Office as the sole entity to dispose of the coconut levy assets that have been approved for privatization, and; mandate the Presidential Commission on Good Government to conduct a complete accounting and inventory of all coconut levy assets and for the Commission on Audit to audit the inventory of coconut levy assets prepared by the PCGG.
PRINCIPAL AUTHOR/S : TAN, ANGELINA "HELEN" D.L. M.D.

ACTIONS TAKEN BY THE COMMITTEE
COMMITEE HEARINGS/ACTIONS:
      1. Scheduled for meeting/hearing on 2016-10-18
          -A Technical Working Group was created to further study the proposed measure together with other Coco Levy Fund bills. The Committee agreed to use HB 6135, the Coconut Farmers and Industry Development Act, as approved in the 16th Congress, as reference bill.
      2. Under study by the Technical Working Group(TWG) on 2016-11-10
          -The Technical Working Group meeting was attended by all sectors which includes small coconut farmers organizations, concerned government agencies and other industry stakeholders. A second TWG meeting was scheduled to continue the deliberation on the proposed measure.
      3. Under study by the Technical Working Group(TWG) on 2016-12-08
          -A third TWG meeting was scheduled to continue deliberation of the proposed measure.
      4. Scheduled for meeting/hearing on 2017-05-23
      5. Approved by the Committee on Appropriations on 2017-05-23
          -Substitute Bill to House Bill Nos. 62, 102, 164, 301, 557, 2175, 2266, 2749, 2833, 2840, 3523, 4089, 4224, 4286, 4632 and 4803 was approved with amendments.
